node.title: Omicron is here so, what's the government doing to stop its spread?
node.alt: Crowd of people wearing face masks walking across a scramble crossing in Brisbane CBD.
node.description: Health authorities say there's no way to keep Omicron out forever but that we should focus on slowing down its introduction to Australia. Here's what's happening to try and limit the number of cases.
node.content:
["There are now six confirmed cases of the Omicron coronavirus variant in Australia and health experts have warned there will be more cases, even with the strictest measures in place.\u00a0", "As countries across the globe close their borders, Chief Medical Officer Paul Kelly is warning\u00a0there is only so much that can be done to curb the spread.\u00a0", "\"We cannot keep this Omicron variant out forever from Australia \u2014\u00a0eventually it will be here,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"Most importantly, now\u00a0we do what we can to slow down that introduction.\"", "So what is Australia doing to try to\u00a0limit the number of cases?\u00a0", "
Changes to international arrivals
", "International students and skilled migrants were supposed to be able to fly to Australia from tomorrow if they were\u00a0fully vaccinated, and they would not have had to quarantine if they were headed to NSW or Victoria.", "But the\u00a0federal government has pushed the date back by two weeks\u00a0due to concerns about Omicron.\u00a0", "Plans to allow travellers from Japan and South Korea have also been halted.\u00a0", "The government is hopeful health experts will have enough data about the strain's transmissibility and severity within weeks so the ban can be lifted on December 15.\u00a0", "", "
Health Minister Greg Hunt on why the government paused the easing of international borders until December 15.
", "
What about Aussies returning home?\u00a0
", "Australians who have been in South Africa, Namibia, Zimbabwe, Botswana, Lesotho, Eswatini, Malawi and Mozambique can come home but they must complete 14 days of supervised quarantine.\u00a0", "At this stage, Australians who have not been to those countries don't have to quarantine if they are fully vaccinated and fly into New South Wales or Victoria.", "However they are required to show a negative PCR test prior to departing. They\u00a0must\u00a0also get tested when they arrive and isolate for 72 hours.\u00a0", "Anyone now arriving in Australia must also list all the countries they've visited in the past fortnight.\u00a0", "The federal government says it is up to the states if they want\u00a0to introduce further rules about returning Australians.\u00a0", "
Are states changing their rules?\u00a0
", "The state and territory leaders will meet with the Prime Minister this afternoon to discuss what other changes are needed, if any.\u00a0", "Professor Kelly wouldn't say today if capacity limits and vaccine requirements at venues would be reintroduced or extended across the different jurisdictions due to the Omicron strain.\u00a0", "\"I think we've had a series of mitigation measures that everyone is familiar with over this whole couple of years and it's always been the sense that vaccination is our major weapon against the virus,\" he said", "\"And then there's the public health and social measures \u2026\u00a0which is another lever that, if necessary, can be looked at.\u00a0", "\"Now, that will be actively discussed today.\u00a0I'm sure it will be part of the discussion at National Cabinet tonight, and that's where those sorts of decisions will be worked through.\"", "
Boosters being reviewed
", "At this stage, anyone aged 18 and over can get their booster shot six months after they've had their second dose.\u00a0", "However, Australia's vaccine advisory body (ATAGI) has been asked by the government to consider whether that should change.\u00a0", "Health Minister Greg Hunt wouldn't say when ATAGI would come back with its recommendations.\u00a0", "In the United Kingdom, the health advice has already changed so booster shots can be administered after three months.", "", "
The National Security Committee met late on Monday to assess the threat posed by\u00a0Omicron.(ABC News: Luke Stephenson)
", "Chief Medical Officer Paul Kelly met with ATAGI this morning and said it was looking at what other countries were doing, but that\u00a0might not play a part in the decisions made here.\u00a0", "\"Remember the northern hemisphere is in winter and so boosters in winter make a lot of sense,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"We are more than six months away from winter.\u00a0We know that respiratory viruses circulate more in winter.\u00a0It's likely that would be when we really want the boosters to be totally actively working.\"", "
Vaccinating kids
", "The Omicron variant has led to further questions about whether children will be offered a COVID-19 vaccine.\u00a0", "The Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA), which determines which medicines are safe for use in Australia, is assessing\u00a0whether the Pfizer vaccine is safe for children aged five\u00a0to 11.\u00a0", "Mr Hunt said the TGA was \"making good progress\", there'd\u00a0been \"no red flags\" and a decision would\u00a0be made in the coming weeks.\u00a0", "However he made clear that if the TGA approved\u00a0the Pfizer shot for the younger cohort, it would not be offered until next year.\u00a0", "The TGA is also considering whether the Moderna vaccine is safe and effective for children, but there is no time line for\u00a0when that decision will be made.\u00a0", "
Do we have enough vaccines for boosters?
", "Five people have tested positive for\u00a0the Omicron strain in Australia.\u00a0", "They are young, double vaccinated and have mild or no symptoms.\u00a0Mr Hunt said that\u00a0showed the importance of getting vaccinated.\u00a0", "\"I would continue to urge the small number of people who are yet to come forward for first doses to come forward,\" he said.", "He was confident Australia had sufficient doses to vaccinate and provide boosters to anyone over the age of 16, as well as offer shots to children once it\u00a0was\u00a0approved.\u00a0", "\"We have the capability of delivering 300,00 doses a day, which was what we were doing in the peak period of September and October,\" he said. \u00a0", "", "
Heavily mutated Omicron variant puts scientist on alert
"]
